pageContext.description: Developed stop-ridge; blade decorated on both sides with raised edges and central rib; single loop; cutting edge slightly burred.
pageContext.surface: Smooth, but pitted in several places.
pageContext.collection: C.N.L. Tollemache Scott,Amprey St. Peter, Glox.,1929: He died 1938 & palstave passed to his daughter, Countess of Dysart.
pageContext.site: England, leicestershire,market bosworth,said to have been found on the site of the battle.
pageContext.remarks: Mr. Scott is Lord of the Manor of Bosworth and the palstave was given to him by an old retairne, who had found it years previously and the exact provenance is unknown.
